Key Match Events: Reece Topley took 4 wickets and set up England for a big win
Bangladesh lost their ninth wicket to Mark Wood
Post-Match Reflections: England will feel better after today's match as they are heading towards a big victory over Bangladesh and improve their net run rate which will play a critical role in the latter half of the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England revived their 50-overs World Cup title defence
Bangladesh shot out of the blocks with Liton Das hitting three consecutive fours off the first over bowled by Chris Woakes
Topley replaced Moeen Ali in the side and performed exceptionally well
England's openers delivered an over 100 run partnership
Bangladesh's team total crosses the 150 run mark and now Towhid Hridoy hits Topley for a boundary to a half volley which was pitched outside leg
Bangladesh's required rate has soared to 13.66 and they are still going at 4.87
